TITLE: How Paynter Jacket Co. Found Success With Limited-Edition Chore Coats
SUMMARY: Paynter Jacket Co., a small label in London, has built a loyal following thanks to its limited-edition chore coats.

TITLE: Can Maxim’s Restaurant in Paris Reclaim It’s Cool After 130 Years?
SUMMARY: That’s the hope at the restaurant Maxim’s in Paris, which recently started a new chapter after 130 years in business.

TITLE: In a New Cannabis Landscape, a Navy Veteran Battles for Racial Equity
SUMMARY: Wanda James is on a mission to empower entrepreneurs from communities harmed by racial disparities in marijuana arrests.

TITLE: In the South, Gas Stations Are Temples of Commerce and Community
SUMMARY: Are they gas stations that serve food or restaurants that pump gas? A new photography book explores the lure of these restorative community rest stops.

TITLE: ‘Ballerina Farm’ Gave Birth Two Weeks Ago. Now It’s Time For a Beauty Pageant.
SUMMARY: Hannah Neeleman, a Utah homemaker with a huge social media following, goes to Las Vegas, newborn in tow, to compete for Mrs. World.

TITLE: Squeezed by Soaring Rent, Small Shops Get Creative
SUMMARY: Some ambitious entrepreneurs in New York City are experimenting with diversified business models to connect with shoppers and bring in more money.

TITLE: What’s Behind This $10 Chicken Over Rice? An $18,000 Permit.
SUMMARY: Blame rising costs, shrunken crowds and a black-market permit trade. Chicken over rice costs $10 at the Halal Plates, a cart in Lower Manhattan, up from $6 prepandemic.

TITLE: Protecting the Rights of Independent Contractors
SUMMARY: Readers who are self-employed react to an Opinion guest essay. Also: Nikki Haley; fears of extinction; cutting sociology; the agony of the bulls.

TITLE: After Figma’s $20 Billion Windfall Evaporated, It’s Picking Up the Pieces
SUMMARY: Regulatory scrutiny felled the sale of Figma, a design platform, to Adobe. Now it’s grappling with employee expectations and a changing market.

TITLE: Kam Ghaffarian’s Moonshots
SUMMARY: The entrepreneur wants to help build the new space economy, one Prada spacesuit and Jeff Koons-filled lunar lander at a time.

TITLE: Inside the Funding Frenzy at Anthropic, One of A.I.’s Hottest Start-Ups
SUMMARY: The company raised $7.3 billion over the last year, as the lure of artificial intelligence changes Silicon Valley deal-making.

TITLE: Beaufort Watches Is One of the Four Brands in New Zealand
SUMMARY: Robert Kwok founded Beaufort Watches, one of only four such businesses now operating in New Zealand.

TITLE: How Minimum Wage Changes Affect Tipped Workers and Diners
SUMMARY: Higher prices? Fewer places? As several states consider lifting wages for tipped workers, here’s how the shift is already playing out in the nation’s capital.

TITLE: Off the Board Game, Onto the Digital Canvas
SUMMARY: Are role-playing games enriching culture, or destroying it? In two shows, the artist Simon Denny spoofs the grandiose fantasy worlds of tech entrepreneurs designing virtual reality.

TITLE: John Walker, Tech Executive Who Popularized AutoCAD, Dies at 74
SUMMARY: He avoided the spotlight, but he helped bring to market an explosively popular computer program that revolutionized the architecture and design industries.

TITLE: These Startups Want to Make Palm Oil. In a Lab. Without Palm Trees.
SUMMARY: Palm oil. It’s in your snacks, your soap, pretty much everything. But palm oil plantations have caused vast deforestation. Can these three tech executives help fix things?

TITLE: Marc Lore Is Trying to Build the Amazon of Food Delivery
SUMMARY: Marc Lore, the entrepreneur behind Diapers.com and Jet.com, would like to disrupt food delivery. But he really wants to build a brand that actually lasts.
